meanings.definition: The whole number or quantity of people or things in question.
meanings.sent1: The caboodle of toys in the box was overwhelming for the child.
meanings.sent2: She packed up the entire caboodle of clothes for the trip.
meanings.sent3: The caboodle of snacks in the pantry seemed to disappear magically.
meanings.sent4: His caboodle of ideas was like a treasure chest waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The caboodle of stars in the night sky took her breath away.

meanings.definition: A group or collection of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The whole caboodle of students cheered for their team.
meanings.sent2: We invited the entire caboodle of neighbors to the barbecue.
meanings.sent3: The caboodle of ducks waddling in a line was a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: Her caboodle of books on the shelf made her feel at home.
meanings.sent5: The caboodle of flowers in the garden painted a beautiful scene.
